revised_title: Tonometrical Observations on Non-Harmonic Musical Scales
tldr: The authors conducted tonometrical observations on various non-harmonic musical scales, measuring the actual pitch of notes using tuning forks and comparing them to equally tempered scales. They found that native ears were satisfied with the intervals they measured, and discussed the historical context of these scales, including the Syrian bagpipe scale used in Scotland. This research provided a better understanding of non-harmonic scales and their differences from modern, equally tempered scales.
